blog.name: incorrect-got-quotes
blog.title: Dead, almost like my interest in the show
blog.description: I post quotes when I feel like it. Mostly nowadays I don’t.If you want to use one of the quotes as a story or drawing prompt, I'm fine with that, as long as you credit me in your story or art. Also, tag any drawings under #oberyn’s saucy art. Yes, I am in fact Oberyn Martell. For those on mobile, here is my ship list: https://incorrect-got-quotes.tumblr.com/list-of-ships Main: garnetislovegarnetislife. SUBMISSION BOX IS (MOST LIKELY) PERMANENTLY CLOSED!

summary: If Arya hadn't been recognized at the Inn of the Kneeling Man and somehow managed to continue upstream and make it to Riverrun...
question: If Arya hadn't been recognized at the Inn of the Kneeling Man and somehow managed to continue upstream and make it to Riverrun before Robb & Cat left, does that change the relationships and choices they make, since they have her back and haven't lost their whole family? Does Robb still do the splitting up of his womenfolk or keep them with him (taking Arya to the RW) or might that mean he keeps Arya out of Walder's way & Cat with her, so after the RW, she can prosecute Arya's inheritance?
answer:
I tend to think that if Arya had somehow made it back to her family before the Red Wedding, Robb would plan for her to stay with Catelyn. He still doesn’t want Jeyne, Catelyn and Arya in the same castle, and under the circumstances (given the agreement he broke with the Freys) he may send Catelyn and Arya direct to Seagard - lest Walder Frey demand Arya stay at the Twins. 

Whether Robb changes his will is a bit more doubtful. With Arya right there Catelyn would probably be even more vocally opposed to legitimising Jon. What Robb wanted from his will, however, was clarity. He did not want his own people fighting about who should come after him. Skipping Sansa in favour of her older legitimised bastard brother is politically simpler than skipping Sansa in favour of her younger, still a minor and in need of a regent, sister.

summary: On a bright morning six days later, she came to a place where the Trident began to widen out and the air smelled more of salt...
caption: On a bright morning six days later, she came to a place where the Trident began to widen out and the air smelled more of salt than trees. She stayed close to the water, passing fields and farms, and a little after midday a town appeared before her. Saltpans, she hoped.

reblog.comment: On a bright morning six days later, she came to a place where the Trident began to widen out and the air smelled more of salt than trees. She stayed close to the water, passing fields and farms, and a little after midday a town appeared before her. Saltpans, she hoped.

tags: a song of ice and fire
the more I read the books
summary: arya stark and her wolf’s blood
title: arya stark and her wolf’s blood
body:
I just wanted to point out something that maybe all of you have realized before, but Arya defending the butcher’s boy from Joffrey is the perfect simetry to Lyanna deffending Howland from those squires! I mean, sure, the outcome was different but here we have two girls who look incredibly similar, both highborn “ladies” who refuse to “behave properly” and that will beat up no matter who, highborn or low, to make justice. 

A little reminder as well that Arya was only 9 years old in the books, and 10 in the show! Lyanna herself was something between 14 and 15 years old. It takes a particular kind of courage to face someone in such situation they found themselves at, and even a greater one in face of “powerful people” and these girls didn’t even flinch or think twice before acting on how they thought they should! 

They are so much more similar than in looks, I just wanted to appreciate that and as Ned said: 

“Ah, Arya. You have a wildness in you, child. ‘The wolf blood,’ my father used to call it. Lyanna had a touch of it, and my brother Brandon more than a touch. It brought them both to an early grave.” Arya heard sadness in his voice; he did not often speak of his father, or of the brother and sister who had died before she was born. “Lyanna might have carried a sword, if my lord father had allowed it.You remind me of her sometimes. You even look like her.”

“Lyanna was beautiful,” Arya said, startled. Everybody said so. It was not a thing that was ever said of Arya.

“She was,” Eddard Stark agreed, “beautiful, and willful, and dead before her time.”

Makes it all the more beautiful the fact that Arya was Jon’s favorite person in the whole world growing up, It’s like a piece of his mother was always there with him. Loving and being his best friend!

This is probably just obvious to everyone out there, but I just wanted to appreciate that beautiful fact, thanks for coming to my TED talk! :)

Now if you’ll excuse me, I’m going to go around the corner and cry my eyes out.

bye.

summary: Arya: Let me tell you something, there is no one who's lost their parents wouldn't like to get them back, even just one of them....
body: Arya: Let me tell you something, there is no one who’s lost their parents wouldn’t like to get them back, even just one of them. And the Showrunners needs to stop being so uptight about necromancy expirements!
